==APT Repository for D==

==="d-apt" is an ATP repository to easily install/upgrade D binary packages on systems like Debian, Ubuntu, Linux Mint, etc.===


To enable it:
{{{
$ sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list
}}}
and add this line:
{{{
deb http://d-apt.googlecode.com/files /
}}}
then update local info and import d-apt public key:
{{{
$ sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get --yes --allow-unauthenticated install d-apt-keyring && sudo apt-get update
}}}
To install packages: (i.e. GtkD library and documentation)
{{{
$ sudo apt-get --yes install libgtkd-dev libgtkd-doc
}}}
----
The following binary packages available:

 *  Digital Mars D compiler (http://dlang.org/)
  * dmd

 * GtkD (http://www.dsource.org/projects/gtkd)
  * libgtkd-dev
  * libgtkd-doc

 * Plot2kill  (https://github.com/dsimcha/Plot2kill/wiki/Overview)
  * libplot2kill-dev
  * libplot2kill-doc

 * Tango (https://github.com/SiegeLord/Tango-D2)
  * libtango-dev
  * libtango-doc

 * Dcollections (http://www.dsource.org/projects/dcollections)
  * libdcollections-dev
  * libdcollections-doc

 * Orange (https://github.com/jacob-carlborg/orange)
  * liborange-dmd-dev
  * liborange-dmd-doc

 * SciD (https://github.com/kyllingstad/scid/wiki)
  * libscid-dev (`*`)
  * libscid-doc

 * SpiritD (https://github.com/div0/spiritd)
  * libspiritd-dev
  * libspiritd-doc

 * Dstats (https://github.com/dsimcha/dstats/wiki/Overview)
  * libdstats-dev
  * libdstats-doc

 * Message Pack (https://github.com/msgpack/msgpack-d)
  * libmsgpack-dmd-dev
  * libmsgpack-dmd-doc

 * Derelict (https://github.com/aldacron/Derelict3)
  * libderelict-dev

 * Gl3n (https://github.com/Dav1dde/gl3n)
  * libgl3n-dev
  * libgl3n-doc

 * DSQLite (https://github.com/bioinfornatics/DSQLite)
  * libdsqlite-dev (`*`)
  * libdsqlite-doc

 * Vibe.d (http://vibed.org/)
  * vibe
  * vibe-doc

(`*`) packages that contains only the library for the host architecture, due to external dependencies.
----
Debianized source packages not available.
----
Every dev package contains a "pkg-config" configuration file for the specific library.

i.e., to compile "Plot2kill" applications, which depends on "GtkD":
{{{
$ dmd `pkg-config --cflags --libs plot2kill gtkd` my_plot2kill_app.d
}}}

Almost all dev packages contains both 32-bit and 64-bit static libraries.

i.e., to compile 64-bit "Tango" applications on a 32-bit system:
{{{
$ dmd `pkg-config --cflags --libs tango` -m64 my_tango_app.d
}}}

All doc packages contains the library ddoc generated with candydoc, and add a system menu entry. Also contains examples if any.
